conversation.content: [nervously] I, um, I wasn't expecting to see you here, Sarah. When they said the examiner's name, I thought maybe it was a different Sarah Chen, but then... well, here you are. [hollow laugh]

[professionally gentle] It's been what, eight years since graduation? Look, if you're uncomfortable with me conducting this assessment, I can request another examiner, though it might delay your case by a few weeks.
No, no, it's fine, really. I mean, we were barely friends back then anyway, right? Just, uh, lab partners that one semester. [swallows hard] You probably don't even remember.
[measured] I remember the organic chemistry class, yes. Now, let's focus on why you're here—your file says chronic pain from a warehouse accident three months ago?
[quieter] Yeah, forklift tipped over and, um, crushed my lower back. The pain's constant now, like this dull ache that never really goes away, even with the medication they give me.
Can you describe how this affects your daily activities? I need specific examples for the assessment—things like, uh, getting dressed, preparing meals, sleeping patterns. [clicking pen]
Everything hurts, Sarah.
[patiently] I understand this is difficult, but I need you to be more specific. For instance, um, how long does it take you to get out of bed in the morning compared to before the accident?
[bitter laugh] About forty-five minutes now, if I'm lucky. I have to roll sideways first, then kind of, you know, inch my way to the edge before I can even think about standing up.
[typing] And you live alone, according to this form? Is there anyone who helps you with daily tasks, or, uh, someone you can call when things get particularly bad?
There's nobody, okay? I mean, my mom offers sometimes but she lives two hours away and, honestly, I just... I can't have her seeing me like this. [voice breaking] It's humiliating enough being here.
[softer] We're almost done with the physical assessment portion. I just need to observe your range of motion—can you, um, try to touch your toes for me? Just go as far as comfortable.
[straining] I can't even reach my knees anymore. God, you know what's funny? I used to watch you in yoga class through the gym windows, thinking maybe I'd join someday, maybe we'd... [trails off]
That's sufficient, you can sit back down. [pause] Look, based on what I'm documenting here, you should qualify for the full disability benefits, including home care assistance if you need it.

[desperately] I know this is unprofessional but, um, I thought about you a lot after college. Like, I'd see your updates online before I deleted everything, and I always wondered what would've happened if I'd just... said something.
[carefully professional] Mr. Davidson, I think the pain medication might be affecting your judgment right now. Let's, uh, finish this assessment so you can get the help you need, okay?
Right. Of course.

[returning to form] Your case will be reviewed within two weeks, and you'll receive a determination letter. If approved, benefits would be retroactive to your initial injury date. Do you have any questions about the process?

Just one, actually. That ring on your finger—is it, uh, recent? I mean, congratulations, I guess. [forced brightness] You always deserved someone who'd actually speak up, not just watch from across campus like an idiot.

[gently firm] Three years next month. Listen, David, I'm approving expedited processing for your case—you should hear back within a week instead. Please, um, take care of yourself. [standing] The receptionist will validate your parking.
